alert.note: Alert for Livingston (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 13 at 11:34PM CST until January 14 at 3:00AM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CST SUNDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST SUNDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON SUNDAY TO NOON CST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, very low visibility and snow covered roads due to falling, blowing and drifting snow expected. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Livingston County. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from midnight tonight to noon CST Sunday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from noon Sunday to noon CST Monday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com.
